body_html: Thanks. For test reproducibility, how likely do you think it is that starting "fresh" tensorflow tests without a reload will cause nondeterminism (as in, old state not cleared by a reload is corrupt)? I've been running without reload, just added a --noReload to TSTL compile, but if I find bugs, worry it'll make it harder to report good test cases.

I've been running without reload, just added a --noReload to TSTL compile, but if I find bugs, worry it'll make it harder to report good test cases.
body: Thanks.  For test reproducibility, how likely do you think it is that starting "fresh" tensorflow tests without a reload will cause nondeterminism (as in, old state not cleared by a reload is corrupt)?  I've been running without reload, just added a --noReload to TSTL compile, but if I find bugs, worry it'll make it harder to report good test cases.
